com.gamelanlabs.chimple2.solvers

Class Solver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gamelanlabs.chimple2.solvers.Solver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Query
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MetropolisHastingsSolver, PriorSolver

    public abstract class Solver
extends java.lang.Object
implements Query
    All solvers should extend this base class. This class describes a probabilistic program solver. If you are looking into implementing a model-specific solver, you should look at the Query interface instead (see LDAQuery for an implementation example).
    Author:
    BenL

    • Method Detail

      • energy

        public double energy(java.lang.Object result,
            MonkeyCage cage)
        Computes the energy of a state.
        Parameters:
        result - A result set returned from the probabilistic program.
        cage - The trace that the probabilistic program went through.
        Returns:
        energy The energy of this state.

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get()
        Returns resultsets as an Object (in order to implement QueryInterface).
        Specified by:
        get in interface Query
        Returns:
        results All saved resultsets.

      • solve

        public abstract void solve()
        The solver is invoked by calling this method. This abstract class requires that all subclasses must implement a no-argument version (ie. with default values for burnin, samples, etc.), but generally a with-arguments version will be called.

      • getArgumentNames

        public static java.lang.String[] getArgumentNames()
        Return the names of arguments to solve() that this solver takes.
        Returns:
        names Friendly names of arguments

      • getDefaultArguments

        public static java.lang.Object[] getDefaultArguments()
        Return default arguments to solve() that this solver takes.
        Returns:
        defaultargs Default arguments

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup()
        Perform cleanup: destroy all objects created by this solver (but not the objects that were passed in).
